definition: headless fly (a metaphor for sb who is rushing around frantically)
see 無頭蒼蠅|无头苍蝇[wu2 tou2 cang1 ying5]
lit. flies do not attack an intact egg (idiom)/fig. no smoke without a fire
pinyin: cang1 ying5 bu4 ding1 wu2 feng4 dan4

sentences.english: Ifthe threat is from the side, the fly leans the other way before takeoff.
sentences.chinese: 借使威脅來自這邊，蒼蠅起飛前會傾向另一側。

sentences.english: Then the second-place man sliced a fly into quarters.
sentences.chinese: 緊接着排名第二的人將一隻蒼蠅切成了四半。

sentences.english: Can you use them for a swatter?
sentences.chinese: 你的耳朵可以拿來當蒼蠅拍嗎？

sentences.english: Does the housefly undergo complete metamorphosis or incomplete metamorphosis?
sentences.chinese: 蒼蠅的成長期屬於完全變態還是不完全變態？

sentences.english: The fly that sips treacle is lost in the sweet.
sentences.chinese: 啜飲密糖的蒼蠅在甜蜜中喪生。

sentences.english: The horse flicked the flies away with his tail.
sentences.chinese: 那匹馬用尾巴拂去身上的蒼蠅。

sentences.english: In each of the urinals , there is a little printed blue fly.
sentences.chinese: 在每個小便池中，都印着一個小綠頭蒼蠅。

sentences.english: Seán's arms became very tired from fanning away the flies.
sentences.chinese: 肖恩的武器變得非常疲憊由範寧把蒼蠅。

sentences.english: We spread white covers over the bowls to keep flies away.
sentences.chinese: 我們在碗上鋪了白的覆蓋物防止蒼蠅。

sentences.english: I know you couldn’t hurt a fly.
sentences.chinese: 我知道你連只蒼蠅都捨不得殺。

sentences.english: Do we really need flies in the studio too?Darned bugs!
sentences.chinese: 我們的攝影室真的需要蒼蠅嗎？

sentences.english: Some creatures project their tongues to catch flies and other insects.
sentences.chinese: 有些動物會伸出舌頭捕捉蒼蠅和其他昆蟲。

sentences.english: We must get rid of these pestilential flies.
sentences.chinese: 我們得把這些可惡的蒼蠅消滅掉。

sentences.english: Wad the newspaper and hit the flies with it.
Some kinds of animals can whisk flies away with their tails.
sentences.chinese: 某些動物會用它們的尾巴趕走蒼蠅。

sentences.english: A fly alighted on her cracked lips, and I brushed it away.
sentences.chinese: 一隻蒼蠅落在她乾裂的嘴脣上，我轟走了它。

definition: cat/CL:隻|只[zhi1]/(dialect) to hide oneself/(coll.) modem
bird/CL:隻|只[zhi1],群[qun2]/(dialect) to pay attention to/(intensifier) damned/goddam
pigeon/dove/various birds of the family Columbidae
to open one's mouth (to speak, esp. to make a request)/to gape

that one/that thing/that (as opposed to this)/(used before a verb or adjective for emphasis)/(used to humorously or indirectly refer to sth embarrassing, funny etc, or when one can't think of the right word)/(used in speech as a filler, similar to "umm", "you know" etc)/(euph.) menstruation/sex/also pr. [nei4 ge5]
